devfestahm23-announced.brief: It is official. GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2023 is going to take place in Ahmedabad, 17th December 2023.
devfestahm23-announced.content:
Mark your dates for the biggest developer conclave of the city as **DevFest Ahmedabad 2023** is here on 17th December, 2023.
[Google Developers Group Ahmedabad (GDG Ahmedabad)](http://www.gdgahmedabad.com/) is for the developers, interested in Google's developer technology from Android to App Engine, Google Chrome platforms to product APIs like the Maps, YouTube, Flutter and Tensorflow, all that Google you can think of. GDG Ahmedabad is back with its annual gathering of technology enthusiasts working on Android, Web and Cloud technologies for a day full of sessions, workshops, showcases, networking with other like-minded industry colleagues and ample fun. This year, we expect over **1000+ engineers, managers, and entrepreneurs** come to DevFest to learn about Android, Web and Cloud technologies, and to experience the phenomenal atmosphere.

Come and join us at [#DevFestAhm](https://twitter.com/search?q=DevFestAhm) 2023 to witness the best of tech, explore and learn about Flutter, Kotlin, Machine Learning, Tensorflow, Google Cloud, Blockchain, Firebase, AngularJS, ARCore, Actions on Google etc. and experience the magnificent atmosphere with tech all around you.
Tickets - Declare soon

## Stay in Touch!
We would love to see you at #DevFestAhm 2023. **Subscribe to DevFest newsletter** or follow us on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GDGAhmedabad/), [Twitter](https://twitter.com/GDGAhmedabad/) not to miss any of our announcements and conference updates. We can't wait to meet you in Ahmedabad, the rising tech capital of Gujarat.
- The GDG DevFest Ahmedabad Team.
devfestahm23-announced.title: Announcing GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2023

c4p.brief: GDG DevFest Ahmedabad was announced, for the tenth year in a row, the conference will bring together 1000+ developers, managers and...
c4p.content:
**PLEASE READ THE GIVEN INSTRUCTIONS with Focus and Attention**

We are back to rock our 10th DevFest season. Yeah! you have heard it right, we hosted our very 1st DevFest event back in 2013. Before going ahead, we want you to check out the last offline DevFest Ahmedabad event, which would help you in realising the level of quality, knowledge and impact that we are expecting from each speaker.



GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2023 has been announced! The 10th edition of the biggest conference about Google technologies in Ahmedabad will take place on **17th December 2023** in the Heritage city of India.

That means that it is time to open the Call For Speaker form. If you are passionate about your work and want to share your experience with the biggest tech audience in Ahmedabad, you knock on the right door.

Last year DevFest broke all expectations of the audience, speakers, and even our ones. With 95% of satisfied attendees, we can claim that GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2022 was a great success.

To keep up this year, we decided to focus on the content. We’re looking for speakers like you, who are ready to rock the stage and deliver the best talk or workshop in the field.

## Target Audience

The majority of our target audience will be IT professionals (Web/Mobile/Backend Developers / Designers / ML Engineers / Data Scientists / Entrepreneurs and Startup ecosystem enablers, etc.) from 0 to 20 years of experience. We would also welcome students and freshers, only if they have hands-on knowledge on technologies!

## Session Format

- Session - 30 to 45 mins talk, detailed talk on any of the topics mentioned below.
- Lightening
- 10 to 15 mins talk, quick overview on any of the topics mentioned below.
- Keynote - 30 to 45 mins talk

## Session Topics

We will accept talks for our planned tracks such as,

**Web / AI ML / Cloud**

- Web Development, topics not limited to
- Angular
- Firebase
- PWA
- Chrome Developer Tools
- Performance
- Accessibility
- TensorFlow JS
- JavaScript
- Modern Web App Capabilities
- UI / UX Trends
- Blockchain
- NFT
- Web3 development etc.
- AI ML, topics not limited to
- TensorFlow
- Vertex AI
- AutoML
- Dataflow
- Firebase
- ML Kit
- Cloud Natural Language etc.
- Cloud, topics not limited to
- Google Kubernetes Engine
- Compute Engine
- Cloud Storage
- Big Query
- Cloud Functions etc.

**Android / Flutter Development**

- Android/Flutter Development, topics not limited to:
- Flutter/Android scalable architecture best practices
- Kotlin Multiplatform and Flutter, Code for one and generate for multiple platforms
- Optimize your apps for Android Go edition
- Generating apps in no time using No-code or Pro-code platforms
- Adaptive layout and latest UI/UX design trends in Android and Flutter
- Start-up & Emerging Technologies
- Start-up and Emerging Technologies, topics not limited to:
- Preparing pitch deck for tech startups
- Raising funds for the technical products and tech startups
- Products demo showcasing technology implementation and how you have solved real-world problems and developed solutions
- Emerging Technologies like EV Charging, Blockchain, etc.
- Why Startups Fail
- Key Insights on building a startup

**MOST IMPORTANT Expectation from CFPs this year**

This year we are looking for the values and experienced based Talk proposals, wherein you have implemented some practices in your product(s) and you have achieved some users growth, revenue growth, code scalability achieved, generated funding, build MVP with solid principles and practices, etc.

This year we are not expecting talks on topics like Getting started with something or beginner level which one can do search over web and find out easily, like “Getting started with flutter development”, “How to implement in MVVM in Android”, “Getting started with JavaScript technologies”, etc.

**DOs of CFP**

- Please elaborate the topic in a proper way to help understand and review your talk.
- Please submit details about your past talk(s).
- Please include links of your past talk(s) presentations, videos etc.
- Please mention key takeaways of your talks and how it will benefit the developers.

**DON'T of CFP**

- Pitching and marketing of the product or company. Speaker can mention the company name but the focus of the talk should be technology.
- The talk should be the original idea of the speaker and should not be copied over from someone.
- The topic should be relevant for the audience and should not be in the practice in recent years.
- Avoid talks like getting started or hello world.

## Why is it cool to be a speaker?

Well, do you know a better way to attend the conference? Here are our top 3 reasons to submit a proposal.

1️⃣ It is good for your career. By being a speaker, you are proving your level of expertise to potential business partners or employers.
2️⃣ It is good for the company you’re working for. Any presentation delivered by an employee adds credibility to a company’s public image.
3️⃣ Unique networking. Being a speaker means you’ll have a unique chance to network with other speakers - the best experts in the industry.

## Perks of being speaker at DevFestAhm

- Full day access to the conference
- Chance of networking with 1000+ developers in the conference

- Exposure to community members on official GDG Ahmedabad social media accounts

- Help from GDG Ahmedabad team members in talk preparation.

**Call for Speakers will stay open until October 15, 2023. Don’t miss out :)**

**Please note:** There is no guarantee that a submission will be put onto the conference agenda! The program committee picks the most interesting talk proposals and informs the selected submitters max by 10th November, 2023.

Any questions? Email any organisers at [pareshmayani@gmail.com](mailto:pareshmayani@gmail.com) OR [dhuma1981@gmail.com](mailto:dhuma1981@gmail.com) OR [jdpatel.android@gmail.com](mailto:jdpatel.android@gmail.com).

Submit a proposal

101.description: Keynote on everything futuristic in Tech this is going to be a hell of a ride with exciting things coming our way in Tech
101.title: Focus on Future Keynote

102.description:
This talk delves into the dynamic synergy of Compose and KMP, exploring how this duo can revolutionize cross-platform development while addressing key production challenges and performance optimization. 
In this session, we will embark on a journey that fuses the expressive power of Compose with the code-sharing prowess of KMP. Drawing from over a decade of Android and Kotlin experience, I will guide you through practical solutions for harnessing this powerful combination. 
- Compose and KMP Integration 
- Production ready compose and gotchas 
- Performance enchamements 
- Compatibility and Migration 
- Tests and release
102.title: Elevating Cross-Platform Excellence: Compose Unleashed with Kotlin Multiplatform

103.description:
Duet AI is set to change the way you work with Google Cloud. It is an available assistant to a variety of roles : Developer, Operator, Data Analyst and more in Google Cloud. It is a new way to work with Google Cloud and is meant to address multiple tasks ranging from learning, onboarding, best practices, application development, analyzing errors and more. 
The goal of Duet AI is to boost productivity and help the users stay in the flow. 
This session will demonstrate features of Duet AI (available in Preview at this time) across multiple personas: Developer, Operator and Analyst. It will also demonstrate it across multiple surfaces that it is available (VS Code, Cloud Workstations and Google Cloud Console).
103.title: Duet AI : Your assistant in Google Cloud

104.description:
This Session will focus on creating GenAI Powered Search and Conversational Experiences with Google Cloud's Vertex AI by leveraging Vertex AI Search & Conversation, it will cover intro to GenAI & LLMs, real world usecases that can solve day to day problems and optimize the processes using GenAI and how those can be implemented using Google Cloud's AI Suite, it will also take a dive into PaLM & Bison Models (Text & Chat) and have a demo of how to create a bot trained on a specific corpus of data such as a website and answer questions it will also cover some real world usecases and architectures that can be implemented using Vertex AI such as automating IT & HR Helpdesk functions, etc. 
- High level breakup 
- VertexAI App Builder 
- VertexAI Conversational AI 
- Underlying Architecture 
- Use cases around creating search applications and bots 
- Working demo of creating a search engine on corpus of documents and data and a chatbot trained on a corpus of data such as a website to answer questions.
104.title: Creating GenAI Powered Search and Conversational Experiences with Vertex AI

105.description:
Adaptation of flutter is really fast. Flutter has surpassed likes of other cross platform technologies. Nowadays, companies want to reuse code and use flutter in web. But, grass is always greener on other side. 
There is lacking on how to use flutter web, how to scale it, how to optimize it , security, deployment and many more. 
In this session I am going to share how we at Tata Digital are using Flutter web for consumer website with over millions of users, thousands of products and hundreds of brands. How we have scaled it and how we are optimizing it.
105.title: How to scale Flutter Web?

106.description:
We will be exploring and presenting in-depth information about the advancements in Angular17. From fundamental architectural improvements to advanced tooling and developer experience updates, we will take a deep dive into the evolution of Angular 
Learn about the revolutionary 
New Control Flow 
Improved SSR Support 
Deferrable Views 
Signal-based Components 
New lifecycle hooks 
Standalone components 
and many more. Join us to leverage the power of Angular 17 in your web development projects.
106.title: Angular 17 Unveiled: A Deep Dive Into Latest Advancements

107.description:
We'll be starting with some stats on online business, essentially growth of UPI transactions in India. A question for traditional startups of why not take your business online? Or are you the one planning to utilise the payment capabilities to the fullest? 

ABC of a payment gateway usage and integration with discussion on widely used as well as non-trendy new payment methods that can benefit not just on business level but on individual level too. 
Success Rate being the most important parameter for a PG, some important tricks and techniques to help improve & maintain the Success Rate. Concept of virtual accounts which solves some major issues with startups and multi-payment disbursements. 
Session end with the use-cases of the trendy WhatsApp Pay Update.
107.title: Unraveling the world of Payments

108.description: Code review is one of the most daunting yet essential part of software development process. In this talk, we'll go over what should PR author and PR reviewer do respectively to make this process a smooth sail using a empathetic approach.
108.title: Effective code reviews with empathy

110.description:
"ALL THINGS ML... Literally... Oversimplified" ~ A challenge that we have taken upon us and are extending it to you ! 

DISCLAIMER: 3 words, Useful - Fun - AI. We would like to stress on the useful part. We are extremely cautious about our sessions not ending up being something you can read in a blog in 5 minutes but you would have to sit through an hour in the event for the same. Exhausting, we relate ☹️ 

This session is to encourage everyone to start asking the right questions and cut through the hype and the black box approaches when it comes to -  

ML Research vs Applied ML: You NEED to know the difference 
Got a problem?: Make it a problem ML can solve 
Critical Thinking: Got a problem ML can solve? Great! Now how to solve it. HOW TO ALIGN YOUR OBJECTIVES WITH YOUR LOSS FUNCTIONS? 
Data Engineering: Sources, Formats, Models… How to piece it all together in the CORRECT CONTEXT? 
Training Data: Where does it come from? Kaggle? Well yes.. But No. A discussion on the critical thinking and techniques required to create training datasets and avoid disasters taking real-life examples of Language Models & Self-Driving Cars. 
Data Labeling: A sneak-peek with jargon you do need to be aware of 
Dealing with Class Imbalance: Data-level methods and algorithm-level methods 
Hands-On MLOps with PyCaret, MLFlow & DagsHub: Covers everything we learnt so far and also includes the rest - Data  & Model versioning, Experiment tracking, Feature Engineering, Model Selection, Model Training, Model Deployment
110.title: ALL THINGS ML... Literally

111.description:
Delve into the dynamic realm of cloud computing & explore the transformative potential of Hybrid and Multi-Cloud environments. Anthos, Google Cloud's application management platform, stands at forefront of this evolution, enabling seamless deployment and management across on-premises, hybrid, and multi-cloud environments. 

Points will cover: 
 -What is a Multi/Hybrid cloud? 
 -Why Multi & Hybrid Cloud? 
- Meet Anthos - Thanos of GCP 
- Anthos Offering Config management/Service mesh  & Pricing
111.title: Unleashing the Power of Hybrid & Multi-Cloud with Anthos

112.description: Bundling is essential to JavaScript applications and we have seen how bundling tools have evolved over time. In this talk we will be exploring that evolution journey and digging deeper into how bundler works, what problems they solve, and how their evolution affects us.
112.title: The evolution of JavaScript bundlers

113.description:
In this session, I'll cover the following topics: 

- The key difference between Navigator 1.0 and 2.0 
- Need of Navigator 2.0 and why should you upgrade to Navigator 2.0 
- How can we use Auto Route to simplify navigation using Navigator 2.0 
- Advanced functionalities of Auto route like: Route Guards, Declarative routing, Nested Navigation
113.title: Mastering Flutter App Navigation: A Deep Dive into Auto Route and Navigator 2.0

114.description: In the glittering world of startups and entrepreneurship, not everything that glitters is gold. This talk aims to shed light on the often-overlooked aspects of starting a business: the challenges, pitfalls, and the darker sides that many entrepreneurs face but seldom talk about. From the common reasons why startups fail to the emotional and psychological toll entrepreneurship can take, this session offers a candid look into what it really takes to run a startup. Join us for an eye-opening discussion that goes beyond the success stories and dives deep into the lessons learned from failure, providing valuable insights for both aspiring and seasoned entrepreneurs.
114.title: Why Startups Fail & Darker side of Entrepreneurship

115.description:
The rapid advancement of ML technologies has created an urgent need for organizations to harness the power of data. While many are eager to adopt ML, the complexities of managing data pipelines, ensuring data quality, building robust models, and deploying them into production often lead to challenges and bottlenecks. TFX is here to bridge this gap. This session aims to inspire and empower data professionals, engineers, and decision-makers by illustrating how TFX can simplify and accelerate the ML journey, leading to real-world business transformation. 

The session will focus on Understanding TFX's significance in modern ML workflows and its tools of ecosystem such as Data Ingestion, Tensorflow Data Validation (TFDV), Tensorflow Transform (TFT), Estimator or Keras Models, Tensorflow Model Analysis (TFMA), ML Metadata (MLMD) and Tensorflow Serving (TFServing). At the end, there will be a Real-world example of TFX transforming businesses.
115.title: Ingest, Analyze, Validate, Train, Test, Deploy: TFX's Journey Towards Transforming Business with ML

116.description:
Dealing with enterprise applications is inherently complex. The typical Big Bang approach or complete system rewrite often doesn't yield the expected results. To stay current, it's crucial to embrace migration, which involves a strategic transition from old to new technology. 

This session will explore migration challenges, such as technical debt, codebase migration complexity, dependencies, and testing challenges. We will also explore different migration strategies, comparing the conventional Big Bang approach with the incremental migration method. Additionally, we'll dive deeper into some practical migration steps, including setting up a hybrid app, code migration, routing, and state management, and implementing essential testing procedures. The session will conclude by highlighting post-migration activities, such as validating migrated code to ensure the future readiness of your application.
116.title: Migrating AngularJS (1.x) enterprise applications to Angular 12

117.description:
Brief about Myself 
What is Generative AI? (Definition, ChatGPT/Bard/Cloude2, Brief history and recent advances , Capabilities and limitations) 
Prompt Engineering Basics (Prompt structure and components, Tips for writing effective prompts, Examples) 
Prompt Engineering In Practice(Text Generation, Code Writing and Assistance, Code translation, Creative Content Generation, Image/Video/Audio Generation, Examples) 
Advanced Prompt Engineering (Chaining prompts and seed tuning, Limitations of prompt engineering, Examples) 
Tips for Using Generative AI (Ethical considerations, Uses in business, art, entertainment, etc.) 
Google Generative AI Tools (MakerSuite & PaLM API, Studio Bot, Google Workspace, Google Cloud) 
Additional Resources and Further Reading 
Key takeaways
117.title: Level Up Your Prompts: Taking Generative AI Results to the Next Level

118.description:
The session will cover the essentials of Terraform, highlighting its pivotal role in streamlining cloud infrastructure management. Additionally, attendees will be treated to an engaging live demo, showcasing a hands-on deployment of a serverless 3-tier architecture in GCP. 

This demonstration will not only illustrate the practical application of Terraform in real-world scenarios but also provide valuable insights into optimizing cloud resources. Whether you're aiming to enhance your skills or simply curious about the latest in cloud technology, this session promises to be a rich source of knowledge and inspiration.
118.title: Google Cloud & Terraform: Building Efficient Serverless 3-Tier Solutions

119.description:
The session will help to understand: 
- A Real-life product use case of how Angular Elements rescued us from the nightmare of spending large amounts of funds, developer efforts and time again & again. 
- Basics of web components / Custom elements 
- Basics of Angular elements
119.title: Angular elements at the rescue!

120.description:
Jetpack Compose is a powerful tool that can help app developers build apps in a far more dynamic, complex and polished way. In this talk, you’ll learn how to simplify building big apps with Jetpack Compose! We'll explore the best ways to structure your app using architectural patterns. Find out which pattern suits your project, how to make your app perform wellIt's all about managing complexity and making your app development easier using different architectural patterns. 

My agenda for the talk includes: 

1. Introduction to problems in Large-Scale Jetpack Compose Apps 
2. The Importance of Architectural Patterns 
3. Common Architectural Patterns and their differences 
4. Choosing the Right Pattern 5. Implementing the Chosen Pattern 

By following these strategies, you can make app development easier and handle complex tasks more efficiently. When you combine Jetpack Compose with the right architectural pattern, creating strong, fast-performing apps becomes simpler and more rewarding.
120.title: Architectural Patterns for Large-Scale Jetpack Compose Apps

121.description: In my humble experience of making multiple GenAI products , I have observed some patterns that what works and what does not. what timeline it works and when it works and not. which platforms to launch and which not to. And much more.
121.title: How to create, timeline, launch and price a GenAI product MVP without making a hole in your pocket

122.description:
🌟 Introduction (5 minutes): 
Unveil the definition and profound significance of Large Language Models (LLMs) in today's AI-driven era. 

🧠 Understanding LLMs (10 minutes): 
Delve deep into LLM intricacies, encompassing their training, evaluation, and fine-tuning. 
Illuminate advanced techniques like prompt engineering and P-tuning. 
Illustrate with concrete models such as GPT-4 and llama for absolute clarity. 

🚀 Applications of LLMs (10 minutes): 
Diverse applications: text summarization, translation, question answering, code generation. 
Real-world use cases across industries and scenarios. 

👐 Hands-on Demonstration (10 minutes): 
Practical demonstration showcasing LLM capabilities. 
Enhancing understanding of LLM concepts. 

🧩 Challenges and Ethical Considerations (5 minutes): 
Addressing challenges: model complexity, controllability, scalability. 

🎯 Wrap-up and Q&A (5 minutes): 
Summarizing key session points. 
Inviting questions and discussions, ensuring participant engagement.
122.title: Leveraging the Power of Large Language Models (LLMs)

123.description:
In this talk, I will be diving into how text containers work under the hood in Canvas and also share insights on how it's built in Excalidraw (ttps://github.com/excalidraw/excalidraw). 
A little bit about the architecture of an Element - how elements are structured, how text is tied to shape 
Cover about Hitbox testing 
When typing a text area is rendered and with CSS we can make sure that the text doesn’t overflow 
Once typed, when rendering in Canvas, we need a word wrap algorithm to render the text correctly inside the container 
Since we are running the algo to wrap the text correctly, on resizing it could be very expensive hence caching is needed. 
Calculating dimensions of word by rendering it on DOM vs using canvas.measureText -> huge impact on performance 
Perf tricks that can be applied 
Aligning the canvas with the text editor 
Takeaways - the audience will understand how text containers work internally in Canvas and get a glimpse of how it is implemented in Excalidraw
123.title: Building Text Containers in Canvas

124.description: In a world where change is the only constant, start-ups find themselves at a pivotal crossroads; innovate or risk fading into obscurity. I will be exploring key topics like Strategies for Innovation, Overcoming Challenges, Investor Insights, Future Horizons. This talk is designed to empower start-up founders, innovators, and visionary leaders with the knowledge and tools to pioneer their ventures in the age of emerging technologies. By the end of the talk, the audience will be equipped with the knowledge, inspiration, and practical strategies needed to navigate the complex and ever-changing landscape of emerging technologies, enabling them to elevate their start-up endeavours.
124.title: Innovate or Evaporate: Elevating Start-up Success in the Age of Emerging Technologies

125.description: Learn through this session how a team of AI and LLM engineers is translating and preserving the words of Buddha through Large Language model. This session will also help you understand how to get started and apply LLM in various other applications.
125.title: Preserving Buddha wisdom through LLM

126.description: This article discusses volume provisioning in Kubernetes, focusing on static and dynamic types, their use cases, volume snapshots, and how to take and restore them. It also discusses operators and CRDs in Kubernetes, highlighting the importance of managing volume effectively. The article also covers volume snapshots and their restoration capabilities.
126.title: Volume Snapshot in GKE using CRD

127.description: Business intelligence is crucial and Google has comeup with LookML and this session ensures that how easy Data visualization is done
127.title: Cloud BI - The Google Looker showcase

128.description:
During this talk I would like to discuss: 

Hard core ideas and practices which I had to unlearn from service to propel in a fast tracked environment of a start up 

- Product trumps process (adopting outcome driven mindset instead) 
- Trying to get away from concept of time sheet, i.e. take as long as you need to deliver as long as you get paid hourly (instead running tighter feedback cycle and faster delivery of something tangible) 
- Being limited to JD (instead adopting extreme ownership of end result) 
- Not implementing Frugality (instead rethink about how to run budget everything in boot strapped environment) 

What are the advantages that I brought to an emerging start up from service based organisation 

- Scalability 
- Documentation/ Defining Playbook 
- Customer Centricity & Delight 
- Diversity & Inclusion in culture as an advantage
128.title: Transforming from Service Based to Product Led Mindset

129.description:
In this session, I'll unpack scaling MVPs using Flutter. We'll delve into Flutter's architecture, transition to advanced databases, and discuss state management intricacies. Performance optimisation and the importance of continuous monitoring will be highlighted. 

Overview of MVP scaling challenges. 
Flutter's architecture: Designed for scalability, ensuring robust apps from the outset. 
Transitioning from basic data storage for MVPs to advanced, scalable databases for larger user demographics. 
Advanced state management techniques for feature-rich, large-scale apps. 
Performance: Insights into Flutter's rendering, widget tree dynamics, and optimization areas. 
Emphasis on continuous monitoring with cutting-edge tools for seamless user experience and early issue detection. 
Q&A.
129.title: Scalability and Optimization: Transitioning from MVP to Full-Fledged Apps with Flutter

130.description:
Join me for an immersive session on Jetpack Media 3, the groundbreaking platform that revolutionizes media libraries. This talk provides a deep dive and demo, highlighting the extensive capabilities and transformative features of Jetpack Media 3. 

Key Highlights: 

Unleashing Performance: Experience a significant boost in media playback performance, enabling seamless and immersive user experiences. 

Streamlined Media Session Management: Discover how Jetpack Media 3 simplifies the management of media sessions, providing a hassle-free way to control playback. 

Rock-Solid and Centralised Architecture: Gain insights into the reliable and centralised architecture of Jetpack Media 3, ensuring stability and easy integration.
130.title: Rise of Jetpack Media 3 - Revolutionizing Media Playback on Android

131.description:
Chatbots are becoming increasingly popular, but they also present a security risk. Sensitive data, such as customer names, addresses, and credit card numbers, can be easily exposed if chatbots are not properly secured. 

The Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) API is a powerful tool that can be used to mask sensitive data in chatbots. The DLP API can detect and redact sensitive data from chatbot transcripts, preventing it from being exposed to unauthorized users. 

In this talk, you will learn how to use the DLP API to secure your chatbot. You will learn how to create DLP templates, configure DLP policies, and use the DLP API to mask sensitive data in chatbot transcripts. 

Talk Outline: 

Introduction to chatbots and the security risks they present. 
Overview of the Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) API. 
How to use the DLP API to mask sensitive data in chatbot transcripts. 
Best practices for securing chatbots.
131.title: Protecting your chatbot from Data Breaches: How to use DLP API to mask sensitive data

dhananjay_kumar.bio:
Dhananjay Kumar is a teacher, published author, and creator of one of the world's largest Angular/JavaScript communities ng-India. Dhananjay's clientele includes but not limited to Aristocrat, NRI, Bethel, Times Now, Accenture, Acheron, AIS, and Kovai.co, etc. 

Dhananjay is a prolific tech writer with around 1000 articles in his credit, exemplary speaker with about 75 talks, and author of the best-selling book, Angular Essentials. Dhananjay is also the founder of geek97, which enables developers to be job-ready, and organizes India’s Largest Angular Conference, ng-India.
